VII.iii.1.C.1.a
.
Definition:Â  Garnishment
A
garnishment
is a legal procedure, authorized by a court order, by which a creditor can collect what a debtor owes by reaching the debtor's property when the debtor does not possess the property.
title: M21-1, Part VII, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section C - Garnishment of Disability Compensation in Lieu of Military Retired Pay (MRP) to Pay Alimony or Child Support
citation: Part VII, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section C
